questions.question: Choose the best description of Despereaux.

choices.answer: Tiny mouse, big ears, who likes to hunt for cheese, common.
Tiny, sick mouse with big ears who likes to read, unique.
Sick, old mouse who can't hear well; common.
Tiny, sick rat with big ears who likes to read; unique.
He is their favorite baby mouse because he talks to humans.
He is intelligent and can teach them many things.
He is devastating to them; he is so different from them.
He trusted member of the family and he reads to them.

questions.question: What is Despereaux's family's opinion of him in the beginning of the story?

choices.answer: Do not let humans see you and don't talk to them.
Do not listen to music or fall in love with the princess.
Do not make soup.
Do not disobey your family by reading books.

questions.question: What most important rule does Despereaux break?

choices.answer: Calls a mouse council to explain humans are nice.
Ignores Depereaux's behavior and thinks he's just weird.
Grounds Despereaux for listening to music.
Calls a mouse council; Despereaux is a danger to all mice.

questions.question: How does Despereaux's father punish him for breaking the rules?
Describe Princess Pea when she tells her dad what to do and he actually listens.

choices.answer: Sweet
Mean
Spoiled
Unique
Sentences him to the dungeon.
Mouse Council forces to repent; leave the Princess alone.
Sentenced him to eat books in the library.
Banished him from the castle.

questions.question: How does the Mouse Council decide to handle Despereaux breaking the rules?

choices.answer: Gave him a hug.
Told him to eat some books.
Pushed him down the dungeon stairs.
Whispered a fairy tale; encouraged him to be brave.

questions.question: What unexpected thing did the threadmaster do while preparing Despereaux for the dungeon?

choices.answer: He wants to be the first mouse to survive the dungeon.
He wants to explore the dungeon and go on an adventure.
He wants to survive the dungeon to return to Princess Pea.
He wants to find Roscuro and Miggery Sow.

questions.question: After fainting from fright, why does Despereaux decide to be brave even in the scary dungeon?
How does the mouse, princess, soup and spool of thread come together in the story?

choices.answer: Mouse loves princess, soup is outlawed, thread tied on mice
Princess sews with thread and feeds soup to a mouse.
Mouse uses thread to swing into the Princess's soup.
Cook makes mouse soup for the Princess and threads a needle.

questions.question: Light comes up many times in the book; what does light SYMBOLIZE?

choices.answer: electricity
the sun
evil
goodness
First person (I, me, my)
Second person (you, your,reader)
Third person (he, she, they)
Despereaux's (mouse, mice,rats)

questions.question: What point of view style is used in this novel?
How does Roscuro's first meaning of life differ from most other rats?

choices.answer: Light, goodness is the meaning of life not suffering/dark.
Eating soup is the meaning of life.
Roscuro says suffering is the meaning; others say its light
All of these.
Ate soup when it was outlawed.
Stole a hen, red tablecloth and cigarettes.
Sold his son, Boticelli, for red thread and a pig.
He sold his daughter for a hen, red tablecloth, cigarettes.

questions.question: What are the crimes the prisoner confesses to Roscuro.

choices.answer: He was in love with the light and princess; she hates him.
He feels bad he ruined the queen's soup.
He feels bad he killed the queen.
He wants to stay at the party but everyone is screaming.

questions.question: Why does Roscuro have a broken heart after visiting the castle party and falling into the soup?

choices.answer: He hopes that Miggery brought light with her.
He is lonely and wants to learn the song.
She is singing song about a princess; wants to get revenge.
He knows the prisoner is Mig's father.

questions.question: Why does Roscuro talk to Miggery when she delivers food to the dungeon for the first time?

choices.answer: Roscuro helps him upstairs; sneaks out when Mig comes in.
Gregory hid him under a napkin on his lunch tray.
Miggery cups him in her hands and carries upstairs.
He found a crack in the wall.

questions.question: How does Despereaux escape the dungeon?

choices.answer: Wants to find Pea to protect her from Roscuro's revenge.
He wants to read another book in the library.
He wants to find his family.
He wants to get other mice together to help kill Roscuro.

questions.question: After Mig cut off D's tail he is happy to be free; why is he excited to be back in the light?

choices.answer: Cook likes the taste of it.
People are hungry.
There isn't even food.
Cook thinks it will bring hope to find the princess.

questions.question: In Book 4, why does cook make soup after the Princess is captured even though it's outlawed?

choices.answer: She forgive him in order to be a good person.
It was a joke and there was "no soup for you"!
Roscuro actually forced her to make soup for all the rats.
Roscuro and Miggery liked soup.

questions.question: Even though Roscuro kidnapped the Princess, why did she invite him, D, and Mig to have soup?
Based on the "Coda", who is the narrator of the story and why was this story told?

choices.answer: a rat, to remind people of darkness
a princess, to bring bling into the world
a mouse, to bring some goodness into the world
a prisoner, to bring wrong into the world
